subject: RE: Invoice 406
body:
I would disagree. Any refund earned by the company is the companies. Regardless of what year it applied to the company. He forfeited all income including refunds when he sold the company.
 
 
Antonio Jones
He/Him
Controller
LCW

From:
 Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, August 9, 2023 8:45 PM
To:
 Antonio Jones <a.jones@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 FW: Invoice 406
 
It’s definitely Randy & Monica’s money.  Send it to Randy and he will distribute to Monica.
 
From: 
Randall Stieghorst <
r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com
>
Date: 
Tuesday, August 8, 2023 at 5:23 PM
To: 
Antonio Jones <
a.jones@lcwmail.com
>, 
payablelcw@bill.com
 <
payablelcw@bill.com
>, Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>, Michelle Murcia <
m.murcia@lcwmail.com
>
Cc: 
Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject: 
Re: Invoice 406
Sorry, to be clear, this a refund from the taxes Monica and I paid for Q12022. They were partnership taxes -- they are not related to Alisa's taxes. But the checks were made out to LCW and we no longer have a checking account to deposit a check like that into. 
 
This has happened various times in the past year and this is the only work around we've found. The checks are sent to my personal address (which is the address for Legacy LCW).
 
Thx, 
Randy
 
From:
 Antonio Jones <
a.jones@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, August 8, 2023 3:50:26 PM
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <
r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com
>; 
payablelcw@bill.com
 <
payablelcw@bill.com
>; Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>; Michelle Murcia <
m.murcia@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Invoice 406
 
 
Hi Randy – I’m confused? If a state/federal government sent us a refund for overpayment of tax, this is just money they’re giving back to us that we overpaid. You had to deposit into our account because it belongs to us. Now if you have a tax bill that relates to a date after the purchase price that you had to pay, we would have to reimburse you.
 
 
Antonio Jones
He/Him
Controller
LCW

Subject:
 Invoice 406
 
Hello Toni,
Attached is an invoice for reimbursement for the deposits that were made to Citibank on Jun 30 and Jul 7 for tax refunds made to Legacy LCW (to Monica and me). They were miscategorized in QB, which I have fixed. I submitted this information to Michelle at the time of the deposits, but the bill for reimbursement was never created in Bill.com and hence never paid to us, so I have created it here and submitted it to payablelcw@bill.
 
Please note that this is a reimbursement and the payment should not be made using any expense account that would generate a 1099 at year end.
 
Any questions, please let me know.
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
LCW

Hi Antonio,
 
I wanted to check in to confirm when I can expect the revised invoice and to update you on the required format of the invoice.
 
I have also spoken to our Accounts payable team to see if there was any flexibility in the format they require to process your invoice.  The good news is, they have confirmed that we can accept the bank details in the format you provided, but they have to be included in the same document as the invoice.  In your email dated the 24
th
, you sent them as two separate documents.  Are you able to combine them?  To confirm, you don’t need to add your bank details within the invoice itself.
 
I will still need the NBC Universal address to be updated to reflect the address of the UK office as per below:
 
NBC Universal International Limited 
PO Box 648
Northwich
CW9 9LS
 
If you have any questions or concerns, please do let me know.  I am keen to get this matter resolved for you.
 
 
Kind regards,
Amesha

NBC Universal International Limited

Thank you for reaching out.
 
Some changes are required to the information on the invoice supplied to me and this is probably the case with the invoice referenced below.  In addition, a PO number will need to be referenced on the invoice to facilitate payment, Naomi is in the process of generating a PO number.
 
Once generated, I will confirm the number along with the additional information required and changes needed to the invoice to submit it for payment.
 
I appreciate that this payment is overdue and you have been extremely patient, I would request that all queries and/or invoices/paperwork are sent for my attention.  This will ensure that the correct information is supplied to resolve this matter as quickly as possible.  It also avoids duplicate information in the payment system.  All of which can lead to further unnecessary delays.
 
I promise you we are making progress with this, the information on file is now correct.  Once the information on the invoice is correct, we just need to submit it for payment.
 
If you have any questions please reach out to me.
 
Kind regards,
Amesha

subject: Re: Invoice 406
body:
Sorry, to be clear, this a refund from the taxes Monica and I paid for Q12022. They were partnership taxes -- they are not related to Alisa's taxes. But the checks were made out to LCW and we no longer have a checking account to deposit a check like that into. 
This has happened various times in the past year and this is the only work around we've found. The checks are sent to my personal address (which is the address for Legacy LCW).
Thx, 
Randy

You had to deposit into our account because it belongs to us. Now if you have a tax bill that relates to a date after the purchase price that you had to pay, we would have to reimburse you.

subject: April Close / Q1 Adjustments
body:
Toni this message was sitting in my drafts because I believe we discussed these matters with Jennifer and resolved them.  Wanted you to have it on hand just in case.
 
 
Jennifer, 
 
Here are the few remaining items that require your review and consideration:
 
From the Income Statement, we have these amounts sitting in Other, Unapplied and Uncategorized.  The amounts are immaterial, but I’d like to clean them up if possible.  
 
Uncategorized Income mostly relates to Micro Deposits, J&J balance discrepancies and a random payment from Quickbooks Payroll that if we can’t identify, I would recommend we book to offset bank fees.  The $200 Unapplied payment is an overpayment from 123 training that should be sitting on the balance sheet as a Pre-Paid / Credit Memo to apply to future payments.  
 
On the $52.87 in April, that’s a payment coming in from Quickbooks.  It may be a refund from last year, as I understand the Randy & Monica used that for payroll previously.  I’d normally put it to Payroll fees, however the account at LCW is very specific to Zenefits (7004.25 Zenefits Subscription).  I’m inclined to just keep it on the balance sheet or book it as an offset of Zenefits.
 
 
Feel like this Ralph Lauren project was misclassified to this revenue type.  Can’t be that special, right?  Will talk to Randy about this one, but probably not relevant to your level of reporting.
 
 
Here’s another that won’t likely have an impact on your reporting, but it looks like this didn’t pull in properly from Bill.com.  It should be translations.  We kept it at the highest level for that reason until we can make sure that you’re OK with us making that change.
 
 
This $325.43 in March is Briza’s hotel and parking for the company event that took place, I believe, in Chicago.  Should be classified to 6007.  Let me know if it’s OK to move that.
 
 
 
Same with these.  They should be classified appropriately within 6007.  Let me know if it’s OK to move those in March.  We can fix April.
 
 
We have a bunch of software from Q1 and April that should be moved to the appropriate vendor on the income statement.  OK to move those down?  No impact to the P&L.  There is also a WeWork in February that should go to Rent.

subject: 2303.1 Accrued Payroll Liabilities - Salaries, PTO + Taxes
body:
Toni this message was sitting in my drafts because I believe we discussed these matters with Jennifer and resolved them.  Wanted you to have it on hand just in case.
 
 
Jennifer, we’re trying to finalize April and May (and see if we need to make any further adjustments to Q1).
 
See attached for the Zenefits PTO report, which reflects $18,396.19 as of 4/30/23.  The GL shows amounts associated with opening balances, Randy & Monica and adjustments for sabbaticals.  
 
I assume as part of the efforts underway with cost reductions, I wanted to be sure we had the right amount in the GL account (excluding the accrued wages associated with the timing of payroll).
 
When we look at Zenefits it looks like employees have PTO balances that might be inconsistent with the accrual.

Subject:
 Cash Flow projections using the Projected Invoices for CFF - by Client & Pipeline Report
 
 
Hi – Projected Invoice for CFF – by Client & pipeline Report. This report doesn’t produce an accurate amount for what will be invoiced in a month.  For example, for line for 72 was already billed and that SOW only has 18k left to schedule and bill. The 72k is appearing because the date on the line is set for august. The Invoice listed to First Bank for 22K was also already billed. We should only include SOW signed for this report, because SOW(TBD) AND SOW sig pending appear in the Pipeline report(See Richemont). We’ve essentially been duplicating the cash flow for some SOWs. It’s important for us to keep the status of the SOW’s up to date because it impacts how we forecast cash. 
 
Suggested Quick Fix
 
Projected Invoices – I’ll update this amount manually to see what we’re going to bill for in the next 3 months.
Pipeline report – verify that amounts on report are not included in projected invoices report. 1 mil of the 1.3 mil sitting in the pipeline is categorized as SOW pending with no dates and extend through 2024. Some SOWs span multiple year. Can I reach out to each consultant to help get an understanding of when we will get this work?
 
Long term Fix
The best way to see what we have left to bill is the WIP report. For that to work we must make sure all the consultants create projects and link them with their associated SOWs. The date on projects must extend past the current date and the budgeted amount must match the amount of the signed SOW. This way the WIP report will show all the open projects/SOW and what is left to schedule and bill on them. For example, the remaining amount to bill on a Johnson and Johnson SOW is 200K but it wasn’t appearing on my WIP or the reports above until I updated the budget amount and extended the due date past today. I can thumb through the open SOWs not linked to projects and have the consultants update them.
 
 
 
Antonio Jones
He/Him
Controller
LCW

 Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Cash Flow projections using the Projected Invoices for CFF - by Client & Pipeline Report
 
 
Hi – Projected Invoice for CFF – by Client & pipeline Report. This report doesn’t produce an accurate amount for what will be invoiced in a month.  For example, for line for 72 was already billed and that SOW only has 18k left to schedule and bill. The 72k is appearing because the date on the line is set for august. The Invoice listed to First Bank for 22K was also already billed. We should only include SOW signed for this report, because SOW(TBD) AND SOW sig pending appear in the Pipeline report(See Richemont). We’ve essentially been duplicating the cash flow for some SOWs. It’s important for us to keep the status of the SOW’s up to date because it impacts how we forecast cash. 
 
Suggested Quick Fix
 
Projected Invoices – I’ll update this amount manually to see what we’re going to bill for in the next 3 months.
Pipeline report – verify that amounts on report are not included in projected invoices report. 1 mil of the 1.3 mil sitting in the pipeline is categorized as SOW pending with no dates and extend through 2024. Some SOWs span multiple year. Can I reach out to each consultant to help get an understanding of when we will get this work?
 
Long term Fix
The best way to see what we have left to bill is the WIP report. For that to work we must make sure all the consultants create projects and link them with their associated SOWs. The date on projects must extend past the current date and the budgeted amount must match the amount of the signed SOW. This way the WIP report will show all the open projects/SOW and what is left to schedule and bill on them. For example, the remaining amount to bill on a Johnson and Johnson SOW is 200K but it wasn’t appearing on my WIP or the reports above until I updated the budget amount and extended the due date past today. I can thumb through the open SOWs not linked to projects and have the consultants update them.
 
 
 
Antonio Jones
He/Him
Controller
LCW

subject: Re: CFF Updated
body:
Yes!  We received 2 payments from Johnson & Johnson that do not match to invoices outstanding.  1 payment covers two invoices that are correct, but the numbers don’t match what we invoiced after applying the discount.  The other payment relates to two invoices from services rendered last year that they informed us would need to be reinvoiced under a new PO (you may recall these exchanges with Dan).  Those amounts were aggregated into a new invoice, which was also paid.  Since the CFF involves real cash in hand and expected receivables, until we can reconcile those amounts we have to back them out of receivables, as we’ve already received the cash and it is sitting in the cash balances, but the uncleared AR is sitting on the AR tab until we can match it.  And, ultimately, the amounts paid twice will need to sit on the balance sheet as a credit against future invoices.  
 
Toni will need to communicate with Dan and our contact at J&J to resolve, recommending that we hold those amounts to apply against future invoices vs. returning the cash.
 
He should start with Dan though, and then come up with a communication strategy that supports our position first.
 
Toni has ALL the paperwork on this one, and it’s a lot!
 
Hope that helps.

No significant changes in WIP
We’re still working through matching some of the receivables to payments received.  Yellow highlighted lines indicated callouts, including the unmatched receivables, severance payments (although I don’t think we had the PTO payouts in our payroll numbers or in the payouts, so may need to update that – was Maria going to send us those numbers for the final pays?).
I pushed the aged receivables out to end of August so Toni can work those with the client accounting departments.
Aged receivables sitting at $358K ($558K less those amounts received and unmatched)
 
Talk tomorrow!

Subject:
 CFF Updated
 
 
Alisa,
 
Couple of things on this:
Consultant pipeline hasn’t changed in two weeks.
No significant changes in WIP
We’re still working through matching some of the receivables to payments received.  Yellow highlighted lines indicated callouts, including the unmatched receivables, severance payments (although I don’t think we had the PTO payouts in our payroll numbers or in the payouts, so may need to update that – was Maria going to send us those numbers for the final pays?).
I pushed the aged receivables out to end of August so Toni can work those with the client accounting departments.
Aged receivables sitting at $358K ($558K less those amounts received and unmatched)
 
Talk tomorrow!

subject: RE: LCW Confirmation of Address
body:
Hello Tamara,
 
Thank you for reaching out.
 
Some changes are required to the information on the invoice supplied to me and this is probably the case with the invoice referenced below.  In addition, a PO number will need to be referenced on the invoice to facilitate payment, Naomi is in the process of generating a PO number.
 
Once generated, I will confirm the number along with the additional information required and changes needed to the invoice to submit it for payment.
 
I appreciate that this payment is overdue and you have been extremely patient, I would request that all queries and/or invoices/paperwork are sent for my attention.  This will ensure that the correct information is supplied to resolve this matter as quickly as possible.  It also avoids duplicate information in the payment system.  All of which can lead to further unnecessary delays.
 
I promise you we are making progress with this, the information on file is now correct.  Once the information on the invoice is correct, we just need to submit it for payment.
 
If you have any questions please reach out to me.
 
Kind regards,
Amesha

Subject: 
LCW Confirmation of Address
Hello Michelle,
 
I hope you are well.
 
I have been informed that the address details that we have on file for LCW do not match those supplied in the attached invoice.  If the address on the invoice is the current LCW address, we will need to get your vendor information updated on our systems. 
 
Please can you confirm your address via a letter on company letterhead and request our system be updated to reflect this.  Please email a PDF copy of the letter.
Once these updates have been made we will be closer to resolving this situation.
 
I have also chased my colleague regarding access to your SIM account.
@t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
 I am copying you in case you can help with this request.
 
Kind regards,
 
Amesha Phillips
Royalty Manager 
1 Central St. Giles
St. Giles High Street 
London 
WC2H 8NU
 
T:020 3618 6206
E
:
 
Amesha.Phillips@nbcuni.com

From: 
Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>
Date: 
Tuesday, June 6, 2023 at 7:48 PM
To: 
Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
Johnson & Johnson
Dan,
 
Hoping you can clear up a discrepancy with J&J.  I’m highlighting my text in bold and yellow to help differentiate it from the images.
 
We currently show the following receivables in Quickbooks:
 
 
Note that 17240211 paid out for less than the invoiced amount, likely based on the remaining value on the PO.  Can you advise on how we should handle that one?
 
We also show the following in Compass:
 
 
Finally, here are all the invoices submitted to J&J through Fieldglass that are currently outstanding.
 
 
I submitted invoice 17240305 on 3/14 (due to the PO issue).  The invoice shows approved in Fieldglass when I click through, but it doesn’t show up on the list of invoices approved for payment above.  See below for the status, which says Next Step is Buyer needs to mark as paid.
  
 
 
Based on your records, are there any issues you are aware of related to invoice 17240305?  Is invoice 17240225 valid?  
 
 
Michelle Murcia

Subject: 
Antonio Jones Accounting onboarding sessions
Good afternoon,
 
As you are all aware our new controller, Toni Jones starts this Wednesday, July 5
th
. I’ll be doing his general onboarding sessions the first day and a half but I do not have any role specific sessions scheduled after that. 
@Michelle Murcia
 or 
@Pamela Coulter
 do you have some sort of accounting manual you can share with Toni? I spoke to Randy today and he said you all have been documenting the different processes throughout these past months. Do you have time to lead a few specific accounting onboarding sessions Friday or early next week? 
 
What else besides QuickBooks, DropBox and Compass will he need to have? 
 
Kendall is leading an intro to Dropbox and intro to Compass session but it will only be general, not a deep dive into those systems. 
Below are a list of topics Randy and Jennifer had for David’s onboarding back in Nov. 
Travel Expenses
QB Accounts & Invoicing
Invoice Submission
Payables
QB & Bank Feeds
Payroll
Month End Tasks & Reporting
Month End Reporting Project 
 
Please let me know how I should schedule his onboarding plan.
 
Thanks,
 
Briza Cardenas

Travel Expenses

subject: Antonio Jones Accounting onboarding sessions
body:
Good afternoon,
 
As you are all aware our new controller, Toni Jones starts this Wednesday, July 5
th
. I’ll be doing his general onboarding sessions the first day and a half but I do not have any role specific sessions scheduled after that. 
@Michelle Murcia
 or 
@Pamela Coulter
 do you have some sort of accounting manual you can share with Toni? I spoke to Randy today and he said you all have been documenting the different processes throughout these past months. Do you have time to lead a few specific accounting onboarding sessions Friday or early next week? 
 
What else besides QuickBooks, DropBox and Compass will he need to have? 
 
Kendall is leading an intro to Dropbox and intro to Compass session but it will only be general, not a deep dive into those systems. 
Below are a list of topics Randy and Jennifer had for David’s onboarding back in Nov. 
Travel Expenses
QB Accounts & Invoicing
Invoice Submission
Payables
QB & Bank Feeds
Payroll
Month End Tasks & Reporting
Month End Reporting Project 
 
Please let me know how I should schedule his onboarding plan.
 
Thanks,
 
Briza Cardenas
(she/her/hers)
Chief of Staff, Office of the CEO

b.cardenas@lcwmail.com

Subject:
 Invoice Payment Update
 
Hi LCW team,
 
All previously submitted invoices have been paid, except invoice 22255 from PO 7000300301. As I suspected, reusing the invoice number caused a processing issue in our system. Here is what needs to be done to resolve the situation:
 
***
BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete
)
LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (see attached instructions)
LCW posts invoice 22255 with a differentiator (e.g., 22255-A)
BSC approves new invoice
 
I’m happy to answer any questions during tomorrow’s meeting.
 
Thanks,
Meg
 
Meg Grow

nboarding

ctive

body:

@Michelle Murcia
 I need to true up Grace’s commissions through 6/16. Can you let me know when the books will be closed through this date so I can calculate?
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
From:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, June 27, 2023 6:18 PM
To:

Cc:
 Maria Mercado <m.mercado@lcwmail.com>; Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>; Briza Cardenas <b.cardenas@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Payroll 6/30/2023
 
Hey, Pam – Hey, sorry for the delay in this response. Working on reviewing legal docs today. Are you asking me what the severance payout for each person is?
 
If so, it is $4,000 for all except JC.
Some may have reimbursements from the retreat that need to be paid out as well, so we would want those competed.
 
Also, to Alisa’s question we need to confirm if Hannah (BizDev) or Grace (Consulting) are due any commissions. I suspect not but we need to confirm.
 
Chuck

RE: Payroll 6/30/2023
Hi. Of those that need to turn it in immedaitely, we’ve received all but Grace, Nassise, and Ashton (a little more complicated). They had 7 days to sign it and, I assume providing time for mailing it in, 5 days to then get it to us.
 
Melissa and Jeffery have a longer period of time and should not be paid out of this payroll. Jake, Melissa and Ashton have an extended exit date in July.
 
My suggestion is the following:
 
Pay out severance in this period (they’ve signed and exited)
Hannah
Kaitlin
 
Payout in first July period (assuming they make the 7/30 deadline)
Grace
Nassise
 
Payout in last July period (assuming they make the 7/30 deadline)
Jake
Ashton
 
Payout in first August period
Maria M (potentially)
Melissa
 
Jeffery is the wild card that we are working with separately. Because of age he has a longer time to consider the offer and we are talking with him about the amount.
 
We can also run off-cycle runs for those who come in at or just before the upcoming deadline if we just want to clear the books asap.
 
Briza – Please check my understanding of the statuses and timing.
 
______________________________________
Chuck Adams 
Co-CEO and Managing Principal

I hope you've been well since we last got to speak on calls or programs.  Hong Kong's opened up with the opening of the Mainland, so COVID restrictions are essentially gone, which is a welcome change.
 
Could I ask you to please look into an invoicing question?  I've been going back over invoicing with the closure of the Hong Kong financial year, and it seems like there's likely to be an outstanding payment for this invoice.  I'd appreciate it if you could check whether this has in fact been paid already, or if it's still in process.  It's possible that with some of the invoices coming through at 2022 year end that I'm not seeing something on my side I should be seeing -- I'll check further as well. 
 
If you have any questions please let me know, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.
 
Best regards
 
Brian

Subject: 
Uta Lausderg - German Translator payment
Good morning,
 
Yesterday evening I received a call from Uta Lausderg, she is a German translator that lives in Guatemala. She asked to get transferred to Pamela. I told her I could take a message and get in contact with them. 
 
The issue is her bank does not accept payments from other providers such as bill.com. The only way she can get paid is through an international wire transfer which Maria F. has done for her in the past. She said her payments are past due and she needs to speak with someone to resolve this. 
 
Can someone reach out to her today?

Uta Lausderg - German Translator payment
Good morning,
 
Yesterday evening I received a call from Uta Lausderg, she is a German translator that lives in Guatemala. She asked to get transferred to Pamela. I told her I could take a message and get in contact with them. 
 
The issue is her bank does not accept payments from other providers such as bill.com. The only way she can get paid is through an international wire transfer which Maria F. has done for her in the past. She said her payments are past due and she needs to speak with someone to resolve this. 
 
Can someone reach out to her today?
+502 40639431

Re: [DKIM Failure] Diligent credit
Credit memo was offset against an invoice: #1
7240330
 (11/21/22) and #
17240330 rev 
(4/1/23)
 
Duplicate pmt should have been posted as unapplied pmt on customers acct in 2022. Instead a credit memo was created in 2022 which hit revenue with deposit posted to deferred revenue. 
So overall AR balance was correct but deferred revenue and revenue was not. I corrected AR with 1/1/23 JE by debiting Deferred revenue and crediting A/R. 
However, this also required me to delete credit memo from Nov22 on 1/1/23 but couldn’t since we couldn’t change 2022 or Q1. To get things correct YTD I still need to cancel impact of credit memo but on 4/1/23.
 
To cancel impact of Nov22 credit memo,  I created invoice 
17240330 rev
 
dated 4/1/23 and applied Nov22 vendor credit 17240330 against this new invoice. AR aging now just shows credit of $12885 for Diligent from JE which represents credit on customer’s account from duplicate payment. Nothing in deferred revenue, cash is correct and sales net zero between the two years. 
 
If you would prefer I can reverse the JE dated 1/1/2 on 4/1/23 but if so then deferred revenue and sales will still need corrected with another JE. Typically speaking, duplicate payments are not handled with credit memos but usually come though on deposit transactions. We can’t alter the 11/1/22 deposit transaction however so a JE is the best we can do or else I have to create a fictitious deposit which I don’t want to do since it involves cash. I have T accounts on this to prove my logic but unable to scan to send to you right now. 
 
Rosie

From:
 Zenefits <noreply@zenefits.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, June 15, 2023 5:00 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Grace Vottero Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on June 16th, 2023
 
We've received your request to terminate Grace Vottero on 06/16/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll mark Grace for termination in payroll on 
06/16/2023
, and continue to pay them unless you manually remove them. Issue their last pay check by running termination payroll. 
Not sure how? 
We recommend you understand 
your state's specific final paycheck requirements 
to remain compliant with the law. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for NJ to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Grace with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Paid Time Off: New Jersey law does not require you to pay employees for their unused PTO upon termination. However, if you wish to pay out employees for unused PTO, you'll want to add $1,346.92 to their final paycheck. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

Dear Pamela,
 
I agreed with Maria that in my case, 
bill.com is NOT to be used
 but payment should be issued via international wire transfer.
 
The reason is that my Guatemalan bank rejects the payment from this provider because they do not work with this type of provider. I checked this with my bank. They can only receive payments from ordinary banks.
 
The only way I can receive your payment is via international wire transfer to my bank account in Guatemala. The information is contained in my invoice.
 
Please let me know if you are not sure how to issue a wire transfer. I can try to help you find out. Previously, Randall Stieghorst issued my payments and he might be able to provide support also.
 
Kind regards,
Uta

Subject:
 Invoice Payment Update
 
Hi LCW team,
 
All previously submitted invoices have been paid, except invoice 22255 from PO 7000300301. As I suspected, reusing the invoice number caused a processing issue in our system. Here is what needs to be done to resolve the situation:
 
***
BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete
)
LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (see attached instructions)
LCW posts invoice 22255 with a differentiator (e.g., 22255-A)
BSC approves new invoice
 
I’m happy to answer any questions during tomorrow’s meeting.
 
Thanks,
Meg

Subject: 
Setting up Vendor Profile - Inter-American Development Bank
Hello Jennifer,
 
I hope you are having a nice Wednesday so far!
 
Could you please help us get our account set up in Inter-American Development Bank’s vendor profile? The instructions they shared are below. We are ready to invoice them so I’m hoping we can get set up as soon as possible – is today too optimistic? What do you think? I am available to support however I can!
 
Thanks,
Grace
 
Please note that firms can register their accounts and request access to the vendor portal through the following link 
https://vendorportal.iadb.org
 
and clicking on 
“Request vendor account (Firms only)” 
located under the Need Help Section.
 
If you have firms with active purchase orders that you work with, we can help them with the onboarding process. Please fill out the attached template and send it back to 
idbvendorportaladmin@iadb.org
; and we will contact them directly.

Hello – thank you for this news! This would indicate to me that BSC has accepted the new credit memo, since it’s in the system! Great! From my understanding, the next step is for us (LCW) to submit a revised invoice against that credit memo with a differentiator, e.g. 22255-A, so that BSC can pay this invoice.
 
Here are the original steps Meg wrote out, we are on step 3:
 
BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete
)
LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (
complete! Looks like BSC has accepted the CM since it’s in the system!)
LCW posts invoice 22255 with a differentiator (e.g., 22255-A) – This is next!
BSC approves new invoice
 
 
@Bethany.Chan@bsci.com
, please confirm if you don’t mind!
 
@Michelle Murcia
, I am here to assist you in this process once Bethany confirms that is what we have to do.
 
Happy Friday and many thanks to all,
Sarah

Hi LCW team,
 
All previously submitted invoices have been paid, except invoice 22255 from PO 7000300301. As I suspected, reusing the invoice number caused a processing issue in our system. Here is what needs to be done to resolve the situation:
 
***
BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete
)
LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (see attached instructions)
LCW posts invoice 22255 with a differentiator (e.g., 22255-A)
BSC approves new invoice
 
I’m happy to answer any questions during tomorrow’s meeting.

All previously submitted invoices have been paid, except invoice 22255 from PO 7000300301. As I suspected, reusing the invoice number caused a processing issue in our system. Here is what needs to be done to resolve the situation:
 
***
BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete
)
LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (see attached instructions)
LCW posts invoice 22255 with a differentiator (e.g., 22255-A)
BSC approves new invoice
 
I’m happy to answer any questions during tomorrow’s meeting.
 
Thanks,
Meg

BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete

LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (

BSC approves new invoice

Sarah

complete

From:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Saturday, May 27, 2023 9:17 AM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Projections
 
Thanks, Jenn. Perhaps we can all talk through your quarterly forecast…as well as this monthly one I have created, that allows for us to manipulate data (more easily than in Michelle’s 13 week or your quarterly one).  
 
Note that in the attached rolling 12, I have turned the pipeline value off…so this shows what is theoretically possible if we don’t sell another thing (which is absurd, but is a clean starting point). We can also then adjust payroll numbers (and any others) to see the short, med, and long-term impact of any cost saving measures or any other strategic changes. 
 
Thx,
R
 
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, May 26, 2023 15:21
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <
r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>; Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Projections
 
Hi Randy – I hope you’re doing well. I’m attaching here the cash flow forecast (both by week – one goes through 13 weeks and the other 12 months), current pipeline and the Q2-Q4 projections with the cost savings. I know there is a lot here and would be grateful if you could review for your thoughts.
 
Have a great weekend.
Jennifer

Date: 
Wednesday, June 7, 2023 at 12:08 PM
To: 
Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Cc: 
Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
Setting up Vendor Profile - Inter-American Development Bank
Hello Jennifer,
 
I hope you are having a nice Wednesday so far!
 
Could you please help us get our account set up in Inter-American Development Bank’s vendor profile? The instructions they shared are below. We are ready to invoice them so I’m hoping we can get set up as soon as possible – is today too optimistic? What do you think? I am available to support however I can!
 
Thanks,
Grace
 
Please note that firms can register their accounts and request access to the vendor portal through the following link 
https://vendorportal.iadb.org
 
and clicking on 
“Request vendor account (Firms only)” 
located under the Need Help Section.
 
If you have firms with active purchase orders that you work with, we can help them with the onboarding process. Please fill out the attached template and send it back to 
idbvendorportaladmin@iadb.org
; and we will contact them directly.

subject: A few things!
body:
Randy,
 
Sorry we keep missing each other.  I have a few things I’d like to review with you… at the very least for a sanity check:
 
On invoicing after a Prepayment invoice has been applied Compass does not sync that invoice with Quickbooks (see 17240382).  Do I manually add that invoice to Quickbooks and apply it to the Prepaid on the balance sheet?  Not sure I’ve ever done one before.  I watched you do it back in March, but this is my first time doing it and want to make sure I didn’t miss a step before I start manually adding things that should be syncing to Compass.
 
On the past due Carta receivable on the books for $5K, I only show one invoice 17240176 in Quickbooks and in Compass (see below), but I got this message from Emani (and invoices attached).  In Compass invoice 17339 is for Boston Scientific.  173391 is for Carta and invoice 22109 doesn’t exist in Compass but does exist in Quickbooks and shows paid. Looks like in Compass it’s Prepaid Invoice 00109… so confusing.  Is this an instance where a new invoice was created but the prepaid wasn’t properly applied?  I’m not sure what I’m looking at here, but tell me if I’m missing something.
 
 
I’ve got a few more, but these are top of mind.
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW 
Email: 
m.murcia@lcwmail.com
Mobile: +1.614.546.8422

subject: RE: Invoice 17240176
body:
Hey Michelle,
 
We received payment for the Ageism and Sexism course via 2 separate invoices.
 
Invoice 17339 shows the payment received for 50% of the Ageism and Sexism course which at the time was referred to as ‘March Virtual Session - How to Be An Ally Across Gender’
Invoice 22109 shows the payment received for the remaining balance including customizations to the Ageism & Sexism course.
 
Based on my records we have received the full payment from this course. 
 
Do the enclosed details satisfy the initial request to the client?
 
-

Subject:
 Bill.com reimbursement process
 
Dear Tahitia, Kelly, Melonya & Alisa, 
 
I hope your week is going well. 
 
As I mentioned in our meeting, I’ve created an account for each of you in Bill.com. You will be using it to report business related expenses and get reimbursed. 
 
You should have received an invitation from Bill.com to connect. Please follow instructions and enter your bank information. Please choose option – employee, Language & Culture Worldwide. 
You will be asked about accounting software – it’s QuickBooks Online. 
 
Attached is an instruction how to create a reimbursement invoice. 
 
If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out. 
 
Thank you!
Alsu

To: 
Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Cc: 
rosie@bookandstreet.com <rosie@bookandstreet.com>
Subject: 
FW: Reimbursement Process at LCW
Pam, we do not need W9s for employees.  All employee expense reimbursements are expenses of the company and are reported as such.
 
Is the information in red below something she added or we added?
 
 
Michelle Murcia

From: 
Briza Cardenas <b.cardenas@lcwmail.com>
Date: 
Thursday, June 1, 2023 at 1:36 PM
To: 
Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>, Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>, Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
RE: Reimbursement Process at LCW
I am aware of that process but with the updated handbook and what Maria M presented at the retreat the below and this part of an email chain do not align.
 
Employee fills out the attached template with receipts and emails it to their manager for approval.
Once the manager approval is made via email, this email chain with the expense template and receipts will be sent to 
payablelcw@bill.com
 for processing, 
CC 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 so I can make sure it hits bill.com. We have been having issues with it not coming through to bill.com.
If the employee is new to bill.com, they will be requested to enter in their banking information for direct deposit reimbursement
IDEA - perhaps part of new employee on boarding they are set up in bill.com.
Accounting@lcwmail.com
 would need their name, copy of their w9, and an email
Then bill.com invites them to fill in their banking info.
Employee reimbursements are processed in the next payment cycle 
(15
th
 or 31
st
) 
from date of receipt. 
 
I’m asking to meet to clarify some questions before answering the staff’s questions and concerns. It would be easier to meet instead of emailing back and forth 
 
Briza Cardenas
(she/her/hers)
Chief of Staff, Office of the CEO
Email: 
b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Phone: 773-938-3767 (CST)

Subject: 
RE: Reimbursement Process at LCW
I am aware of that process but with the updated handbook and what Maria M presented at the retreat the below and this part of an email chain do not align.
 
Employee fills out the attached template with receipts and emails it to their manager for approval.
Once the manager approval is made via email, this email chain with the expense template and receipts will be sent to 
payablelcw@bill.com
 for processing, 
CC 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 so I can make sure it hits bill.com. We have been having issues with it not coming through to bill.com.
If the employee is new to bill.com, they will be requested to enter in their banking information for direct deposit reimbursement
IDEA - perhaps part of new employee on boarding they are set up in bill.com.
Accounting@lcwmail.com
 would need their name, copy of their w9, and an email
Then bill.com invites them to fill in their banking info.
Employee reimbursements are processed in the next payment cycle 
(15
th
 or 31
st
) 
from date of receipt. 
 
I’m asking to meet to clarify some questions before answering the staff’s questions and concerns. It would be easier to meet instead of emailing back and forth

subject: Re: FYI ONLY: Jeffrey's sabbatical dates / calc
body:
Most coverage is monthly, so if someone is terminated mid-month, their benefits typically continue through the end of the calendar month – and with an involuntary termination, you may consider continuing for a brief period beyond (say 1 extra month).  You should be able to offer mini-COBRA coverage at the expense of the employee for up to 12 months based on State provisions; Zenefits should be able to help here.
 
The rest is a business case decision.
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW

m.murcia@lcwmail.com
Mobile: +1.614.546.8422

Subject:
 FYI ONLY: Jeffrey's sabbatical dates / calc
 
Hi Chuck – here’s the math on JC’s sabbatical days for your records.
 
Operating under the assumption that Jeffrey is not working on the Quad project while on leave, it looks like he will need to take 17 days of unpaid leave.
 
# of Work Days Jun-Jul-Aug
64 work days 
Jun has 21 days (22-1 holiday on 6.19), Jul has 20 days (21=1 holiday on 7.4), Aug has 23 days.
21+20+23=64
 
# of Available Leave Days
47 days paid leave
27 PTO days +
1 floating holiday (the old birthday holiday) +
10 granted days +
5 additional “grace” days (that you had previously stated could be added to cover unpaid days) +
3 PTO carry-over days (left in Zenefits) +
1 comp day =47 days paid leave 
 
64-47=
17 unpaid days
  
 
This gets him through Aug 8, so UNPAID dates are: Aug 9, 10, 11, 14, 15 (5 days unpaid in the first pay period in August), and Aug 16, 17, 18, 21, 22, 23, 24, 25, 28, 29, 30, 31 (all days unpaid in the 2
nd
 pay period in August)
 
RP
 
-
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Rebecca M. Parrilla (she/her)
Director of Content & Research, LCW
Phone: +1.773.938.3784

We’ve just signed a new SOW for a training with our client Inter-American Development Bank, and they asked me to send over our credit card form, so that they can handle this payment using their corporate credit card. I’ve cut/paste the message below for clarity. Is this something we have readily that you can share? I understand that in the past, this client has paid with PayPal. The invoice was already created in Scoro and is ready to go…
 
Please let me know if you can share the credit card form, or if you need me to send a new request to the client.
 
Thank you!
Grace
 
“I hope you're doing well. To process the payment using our corporate credit card, we require a credit card form from LCW. To ensure a speedy processing of the payment, could you please provide us with the form today?”

subject: RE: Reimbursement Process at LCW
body:
I am aware of that process but with the updated handbook and what Maria M presented at the retreat the below and this part of an email chain do not align.
 
Employee fills out the attached template with receipts and emails it to their manager for approval.
Once the manager approval is made via email, this email chain with the expense template and receipts will be sent to 
payablelcw@bill.com
 for processing, 
CC 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 so I can make sure it hits bill.com. We have been having issues with it not coming through to bill.com.
If the employee is new to bill.com, they will be requested to enter in their banking information for direct deposit reimbursement
IDEA - perhaps part of new employee on boarding they are set up in bill.com.
Accounting@lcwmail.com
 would need their name, copy of their w9, and an email
Then bill.com invites them to fill in their banking info.
Employee reimbursements are processed in the next payment cycle 
(15
th
 or 31
st
) 
from date of receipt. 
 
I’m asking to meet to clarify some questions before answering the staff’s questions and concerns. It would be easier to meet instead of emailing back and forth 
 
Briza Cardenas
(she/her/hers)
Chief of Staff, Office of the CEO
Email: 
b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Phone: 773-938-3767 (CST)

 Tuesday, May 23, 2023 12:21 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
 
Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits
 
Zenefits
  •   50 Beale St. San Francisco, CA, United States 94105
Send to a Friend
  •  
Unsubscribe

subject: FW: [DKIM Failure]  Q1 P&L results used for bank report
body:
HI Jennifer
Understood. Just wanted to provide the option if you did want to do a JE since overall not a material net P&L change. Of the $13,355.90 change to the Q1 P&L I picked the largest items that changed and provided explanations on each below.
 
22,500 increase in total revenue
(28872.77) increase in expense 6003.3
(1500.00) increase in expense     5004.8
(1050.00) increase in expense     8004
(1206.25) increase in expense     7003.2
(1001.93) increase in expense     7004.02
($850.30) increase in expense     6007.03-6007.08
(600.00) increase in expense       8005
($12,581.25) net change to P&L explained (net loss increased)
 
Revenue
-total revenue increased $22500 which represented the amount of the 2022 BSC deferred revenue you had brought up that needed recognizing for Q1. We agreed with our finding.
 
6003.3 SIMPLE IRA – Match
 $28,872.77 increase to expense to get accrual correct at 3/31/23 (Due to 2022 ending accrual balance having debit balance of   $15,939.62. Should have been credit balance). 
 
5004.8 Trainer/Facilitator Fees 
$1500 increase to expense on NCB Feb23 bill no. 20230201. Change made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/11/23
 
8004 Professional Fees 
$1050 increase to expense on Eisner Advisory Jan23 bill no. 1231262. Change made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/12/23
 
7003.2 Computer Support 
$1206.25 increase to expense on TeamLogic Feb23 bills no. 1364 and 1371. Adds made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/12/23
 
7004.02 Software Subscriptions 
$1001.93 increase to expense on Peerspace Inc Feb23 bill. Add made B&S on 5/5/23. Feb23 Credit card purchases not reconciled until May. 
 
6007.03 Hotels through 6007.08 Taxi/Ground 
$850.30 increase to expense on March credit card purchases. Added by B&S on 5/5/23. Mar23 credit card purchases not reconciled until May.
 
8005 Charitable Contributions 
$600 increase to expense on on March credit card purchases. Add made by B&S on 5/5/23. Mar23 credit card purchases not reconciled until May.
 
Rosie

subject: RE: BCW and CDW Receivables
body:
Hi Michelle,
 
It is so sad to hear about these payments. Can I ask, how long have these been outstanding? How long have we known that these clients owe us for these invoices? And, with this email, can I safely assume that these are the 
only
 invoices that are still outstanding for any of my clients?
 
For CDW:
Invoice No. 17240171
 (for 2,000) – As mentioned, this should never have been invoiced. The information about this invoice must have been lost in David’s departure; I will manage the client frustrations – please don’t let my previous message alarm you – but I do want to make sure they know very quickly that this was our mistake. This will make it easier to get information on the pending payment…
Invoice No. 17240165
 (for 25,000) – I can’t believe this has not been paid! The only explanation I can think of is also tied to information that David would have held. He was to set up our Vendor account for CDW and submit the invoice for $25,000 (see attached email). Can you confirm that this is how we submitted? If we did not, we have to register in their system and then follow up with Pamela. If we are already registered and they just haven’t paid, I can send a follow up note to Pamela and my counterpart, Priscilla. 
 
For BCW – can you share with me the email you sent to this client? I never had the privilege of actually meeting this client – I took it over from a departing consultant and was under the impression it was already invoiced – but I’m happy to send a follow up note to underscore your reminder about the invoice.
 
Thank you so much, it is amazing to know we’re catching up on our outstanding invoices. Please let me know how I can support these or any other outstanding invoices further.
 
Thanks!!
Grace

 Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, May 30, 2023 2:32 PM

subject: RE: BCW and CDW Receivables
body:
Hi Michelle,
 
I will send a longer reply shortly, but please can you urgently inform CDW that they are 
not
 
being
 invoiced for the 2,000? This is a sensitive subject with that client, because LCW incorrectly invoiced them in the past for this amount. This was for work they 
never agreed to buy
, and we 
did not deliver
.
 
This was a mistake that our previous accounting team made – he invoiced the client without my consent, apparently this was due to a Scoro issue for a proposal they ultimately decided not to do. In Scoro, that quote never made its way to Signed. It was a BD Proposal and then should now show as cancelled. 
 
I know that our QuickBooks and Scoro don’t match exactly, so I am always happy to resolve these questions internally, before we send messages to our clients.
 
Thanks.
Grace

Subject:
 Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
 
Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits
 
Zenefits
  •   50 Beale St. San Francisco, CA, United States 94105

Subject:
 Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
 
Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits
 
Zenefits
  •   50 Beale St. San Francisco, CA, United States 94105

subject: Re: [DKIM Failure]  Q1 P&L results used for bank report
body:
Hi Michelle,
The below is what I want to send to Jennifer to explain the $13K increase to net loss for Q1 (QB P&L reported to bank versus what is in QB now). Please review and suggest any wording changes before I send. 
 
HI Jennifer
Understood. Just wanted to provide the option if you did want to do a JE since overall not a material net P&L change. Of the $13,355.90 change to the Q1 P&L I picked the largest items that changed and provided explanations on each below.
 
22,500 increase in total revenue
(28872.77) increase in expense 6003.3
(1500.00) increase in expense     5004.8
(1050.00) increase in expense     8004
(1206.25) increase in expense     7003.2
(1001.93) increase in expense     7004.02
($850.30) increase in expense     6007.03-6007.08
(600.00) increase in expense       8005
($12,581.25) net change to P&L explained (net loss increased)
 
Revenue
-total revenue increased $22500 which represented the amount of the 2022 BSC deferred revenue you had brought up that needed recognizing for Q1. We agreed with our finding.
 
6003.3 SIMPLE IRA – Match
 $28,872.77 increase to expense to get accrual correct at 3/31/23 (Due to 2022 ending accrual balance having debit balance of   $15,939.62. Should have been credit balance). 
 
5004.8 Trainer/Facilitator Fees 
$1500 increase to expense on NCB Feb23 bill no. 20230201. Change made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/11/23
 
8004 Professional Fees 
$1050 increase to expense on Eisner Advisory Jan23 bill no. 1231262. Change made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/12/23
 
7003.2 Computer Support 
$1206.25 increase to expense on TeamLogic Feb23 bills no. 1364 and 1371. Adds made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/12/23
 
7004.02 Software Subscriptions 
$1001.93 increase to expense on Peerspace Inc Feb23 bill. Add made B&S on 5/5/23. Feb23 Credit card purchases not reconciled until May. 
 
6007.03 Hotels through 6007.08 Taxi/Ground 
$850.30 increase to expense on March credit card purchases. Added by B&S on 5/5/23. Mar23 credit card purchases not reconciled until May.
 
8005 Charitable Contributions 
$600 increase to expense on on March credit card purchases. Add made by B&S on 5/5/23. Mar23 credit card purchases not reconciled until May.
 
Rosie

subject: Re: AR >90 days
body:
Jennifer, please find attached the AR > 90 days.  I added a few schedules for noted issues.  Before I correct anything, I wanted to run these by you.
 
Emerson is a bit of an issue.  According to this note from Randy in Compass, it was paid in the wrong currency, which resulted in the amount of $2,058.40.
 
Emerson also shows up on the Due to Randy & Monica reconciliation file for the purchase price reconciliation as invoice 17334 dated 3/31/22.  This invoice does not exist in Compass.  It also does not appear in the Quickbooks client created to track the receivables due to Randy & Monica.  
 
In the attached file, I have removed it from AR Due to Randy & Monica, which adjusts the balance due to $448,409.26.
 
The final unpaid invoice 17324 shows in Compass in the record for invoice 17326, as follows:
 
 
It does not show as an invoice in Compass, and isn’t included in the invoice total for Legacy LCW, so not sure it should show up on the reconciliation list.  
 
There’s only 1 invoice showing on your reconciliation as outstanding and it’s Diligent invoice 17324 for $175, which does not appear in Compass.  I don’t believe there are any other amounts owed to Randy and Monica.  
 
Current balance owing against invoice: $2,275 ($175 Diligent – should be removed from the R&M invoice and from the recon as it doesn’t exist, $2,100 Emerson – listed as $3,900 on the invoice but should have been $1,800 per QB, Compass and your recon). In addition, they would owe LCW $86.28 for fees on IADB not yet recorded and $2,058.40 for Emerson.  You also note in your file at the bottom a fee of $41.60 for Emerson.  You don’t need that because it and the amount listed for Emerson in error total $2,100 ($2,058.40 and $41.60).
 
Let me know if you have any questions.
 
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW

m.murcia@lcwmail.com
Mobile: +1.614.546.8422

subject: RE: Payment method
body:
Same person! Probably you have his Paypal email. No worries. It’s not a scam 
😉
Enjoy the long weekend!
 
María
 
From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Friday, May 26, 2023 11:52 AM
To:
 Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>; Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Payment method
 
Maria
I have a different email for Jose in Bill.com. 
Can you confirm this is the same person?  
I have 
joseazev@translate.com.br
 – just want to make sure not scam email.
I can update the email and invite him to update his banking information in Bill.com, just need confirmation it is okay to do this.
 
 
Pamela Coulter
Accounting
 
Email: 
p.coulter@lcwmail.com
Mobile: 
+1.937.605.9970
 
   
www
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
 
 
From: 
Maria Fagrelius <
m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com
>
Date: 
Friday, May 26, 2023 at 12:25 PM
To: 
Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject: 
FW: Payment method
Hi. Can you please let me know if our vendor, Jose Antonio Acevedo (Brazil), can change payment method? He has opened an account in the USA. He just want to make sure before he includes in the next invoice.
Thank you for letting me know and enjoy the long weekend.
 
 
María
 
From:
 José Antonio Azevedo <
translator@joseazevedo.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, May 26, 2023 9:02 AM
To:
 Maria Fagrelius <
m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Maya Benoit <
M.Benoit@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Payment method
 
Hi María,
 
Thanks for your reply!
 
OK, but what if your accounting department says that they don't accept the new payment method? I think it would be better to confirm with them first and only them submit the invoice with my banking details. But if you still think that it's better to inform them about my request only when submitting my invoice, that's OK for me. Please confirm.
 
Thanks again and TGIF!!!
José
 
----- Original Message ----- 
From:
 
Maria Fagrelius
 
To:
 
José Antonio Azevedo
 
Cc:
 
Maya Benoit
 
Sent:
 Friday, May 26, 2023 10:00 AM
Subject:
 RE: Payment method
 
Hi Jose,
Hope you had a fantastic week. TGIF! 
Next time you submit an invoice, if you want to place there your new bank information and remind us via email, we can tell our accounting department. I think this is the best way to change your information on file 
😉
Cheers!
 
 
María
 
From:
 José Antonio Azevedo <
translator@joseazevedo.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, May 25, 2023 6:04 PM
To:
 Maria Fagrelius <
m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Payment method
 
Hi María,
 
It's been quite a while! I hope everything is well with you and your family!
 
I don't know if you could help me with this issue but anyway I will try: I have opened a bank account in the USA and I'd like to know if it would be possible to receive my future payments via a wire transfer into that account. I suppose that your accounting is in charge of these financial issues, so could you please forward my request to them?
 
Thanks a lot for your help!
 
All the best,
José

>

 Thursday, May 25, 2023 6:04 PM
To:
 Maria Fagrelius <
m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Payment method
 
Hi María,
 
It's been quite a while! I hope everything is well with you and your family!
 
I don't know if you could help me with this issue but anyway I will try: I have opened a bank account in the USA and I'd like to know if it would be possible to receive my future payments via a wire transfer into that account. I suppose that your accounting is in charge of these financial issues, so could you please forward my request to them?
 
Thanks a lot for your help!
 
All the best,
José

Subject:
 Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
 
Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits

The below excerpt talks about what ACA compliance involves (from doing a general search on Google).  
We'll have to contact Trinet Customer Care on Tuesday to assist if necessary. We have the Trinet Customer Care link at the bottom of Alisa's email.
Rosie
Small businesses are those with fewer than 50 full-time employees. ACA reporting compliance for employers with fewer than 50 employees requires them to provide information about the Marketplace to their employees, regardless of whether they plan on offering health

k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Invoicing - PA22-36 - Prudential
 
Dear Sarah, Nassise, and Kaitlin
 
I hope you've been well since we last got to speak on calls or programs.  Hong Kong's opened up with the opening of the Mainland, so COVID restrictions are essentially gone, which is a welcome change.
 
Could I ask you to please look into an invoicing question?  I've been going back over invoicing with the closure of the Hong Kong financial year, and it seems like there's likely to be an outstanding payment for this invoice.  I'd appreciate it if you could check whether this has in fact been paid already, or if it's still in process.  It's possible that with some of the invoices coming through at 2022 year end that I'm not seeing something on my side I should be seeing -- I'll check further as well. 
 
If you have any questions please let me know, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.
 
Best regards
 
Brian

subject: NBCUniversal - Invitation to Register
body:
Dear MICHELLE MURCIA
,
You are receiving this message because you will be, or have recently begun doing business with NBCUniversal.  You are required to register in our Vendor Portal and complete your profile for us to be able to issue POs and/or process your invoices for payment.
How to update your profile?
1. Visit https://nbcuni.apexportal.net to log in using the username and password below. These credentials are valid for 21 days from the date of original receipt. Please do not share these credentials with anyone.
2. Upon logging in using the User Name and Password provided below, you will receive a second email containing a one-time Authentication Code. Enter the one-time Authentication Code in our Vendor Management Portal and answer the security questions. If you do not receive an email, Click on the ‘Resend Authentication Code’ option. 
3. After submitting your security question answers, you will be prompted to reset your password. 
After you can update your profile; it will take you approximately 10-15 minutes to complete it.
4. Please use your login credentials to manage and update the details on your account on an ongoing basis.
Company Name:        LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE, LLC
Username:                  SP.MICHELLE.MURCIA.51
Password:                   jb76-{FA]l8sn8iK(2
Please be prepared to provide the following on your registration:
1. Company Contact Information
2. Tax Registration Information (TIN, VAT , GST, HST, ID,  CIF, NIF etc as applicable)
3. Banking Information for Payments
4. Document Uploads 
If you have any questions please reach out to  NBCUniversal Accounts Payable Helpdesk team to assist you with any questions or support you may need at info@apexportal.nbcuni.com.
Vendor Management Team,
NBCUniversal
THIS IS AN AUTOMATED MESSAGE GENERATED BY NBCUniversal
PLEASE DO NOT REPLY DIRECTLY TO THIS MESSAGE.

APEX Analytix - 1501 Highwoods Blvd, Suite 200-A, Greensboro, NC 27410

I attempted to proceed with the next step in the hopes that you could override the initial rejection, but was not able to move forward. 
 
Any help you can offer would be greatly appreciated!

subject: Re: Cash forecast
body:
Apologies, didn’t address Voya.  Mostly related to change in submission process (and initially no instructions on how to submit invoices through the portal), and lack of funds on the POs under which the services were delivered.
 
There have been multiple issues with Voya:
 
They transitioned from email to an accounting portal.  
Dan changed the invoices after they were initially prepared based on changes to purchase orders, as I understand.
I submitted an invoice through the portal without the attachment, which caused a delay.
I re-submitted the invoice today but with the wrong value ($5K vs. $8K), and have reached back to them to correct the value.
The remaining invoice sitting in Compass is booked to a PO that does not have significant funds available.  Dan is aware and it’s in his hands to get the amount of the PO increased.  I forwarded it to the invoicing group at Voya to see if they can increase the value of the PO.
 
 
Michelle Murcia

LCW

Subject:
 Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
 
Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits
 
Zenefits
  •   50 Beale St. San Francisco, CA, United States 94105

Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits
 
Zenefits
  •   50 Beale St. San Francisco, CA, United States 94105
Send to a Friend
  •  
Unsubscribe

Subject:
 Quote confirmation and % complete - Due May 16 - 3PM CDT
 
Hey, folks – Thank you for jumping on the impromptu call. I will summarize the request for you again and for Dan who was unable to attend.
 
As part of the loan structure for LCW the bank performs a quarterly covenant test on our performance. While the test includes a review of revenue/profit and liabilities it also includes some additional accounting requirements beyond revenue or operating capital in the bank. It is that measure here we are at risk to fall short against this quarter.
 
You are also aware that we are still struggling with deriving trusted forecasts from our current accounting processes. Given that, we are asking you to connect with your direct reports and walk with them over each of their quotes line by line and confirm each deliverable, the date of delivery, and the percentage of work completed across the entirety of the quote. If there has been a change of delivery date note that in the appropriate field on the quote in Compass. Once a quote review has been completed please note in the comments section of the quote. It can be something like “Delivery dates confirmed 4/15/2023”
 
It is not necessary for consultants to know the details of why we are going through the exercise and we don’t want to cause undo concern so I would be judicious in explaining the need for this to be completed. It should actually be best practice.
 
Please use the attached ‘Revenue Percent to Completion’ document to capture the data. The client names will link you directly to the quotes in Compass. The other document is a clean export of a work report and can be used for referencing which consultant owns what client/quote.
 
Let me know if you have any questions.
 
Chuck
 
______________________________________
Chuck Adams 
Co-CEO and Managing Principal

Chicago, IL 60640

Sent:
 Friday, May 12, 2023 2:33 PM
To:
 CLT <
clt@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Quote confirmation and % complete - Due May 16 - 3PM CDT
 
Hey, folks – Thank you for jumping on the impromptu call. I will summarize the request for you again and for Dan who was unable to attend.
 
As part of the loan structure for LCW the bank performs a quarterly covenant test on our performance. While the test includes a review of revenue/profit and liabilities it also includes some additional accounting requirements beyond revenue or operating capital in the bank. It is that measure here we are at risk to fall short against this quarter.
 
You are also aware that we are still struggling with deriving trusted forecasts from our current accounting processes. Given that, we are asking you to connect with your direct reports and walk with them over each of their quotes line by line and confirm each deliverable, the date of delivery, and the percentage of work completed across the entirety of the quote. If there has been a change of delivery date note that in the appropriate field on the quote in Compass. Once a quote review has been completed please note in the comments section of the quote. It can be something like “Delivery dates confirmed 4/15/2023”
 
It is not necessary for consultants to know the details of why we are going through the exercise and we don’t want to cause undo concern so I would be judicious in explaining the need for this to be completed. It should actually be best practice.
 
Please use the attached ‘Revenue Percent to Completion’ document to capture the data. The client names will link you directly to the quotes in Compass. The other document is a clean export of a work report and can be used for referencing which consultant owns what client/quote.
 
Let me know if you have any questions.
 
Chuck
 
______________________________________
Chuck Adams 
Co-CEO and Managing Principal
 
LCW
4753 N Broadway, Floor 2
Chicago, IL 60640
Office: 
+1.773.938.4285
Mobile: +1.630.373.5068

From Dan today…
Hi Chuck--Here are the updates for revenue projections from me, Andera, and Conner. A few notes:
We found some additional revenue (noted in Green)--deliverables that did not have dates attached to them, that are happening
Some of what was on this list was already invoiced, and we've corrected it in compass (If the deliverable was already invoiced, but it was invoiced before the projected date, we will temporarily be double counting the revenue in compass. In other words, a deliverable could show up as both invoiced and projected, based on these reports.)
There's the Genpact situation, which I think you may be aware of. Andrea continues to get no traction, and the stakeholder is on leave

subject: Voya Invoice 17240318
body:
Dan,
 
Copying Randy on this one just to make sure I’ve got things sorted in Quickbooks appropriately on this one.  This invoice was in Ready to Invoice, moved to Unsubmitted and then Submitted last week or earlier this week at $8K.  I 
think
 it’s the one that needed the PO?  
 
I just noticed it pop back into Ready to Invoice with a different dollar amount.  Can you confirm that the dollar amount went down?  Not sure I understand what happened, so want to be sure we fix in QB if that’s the case because now that it’s synced it’s showing as an $8K receivable in Compass with a $1K discount (am I reading that right, Randy?).  See screen grab below.
 
Dan, if you can confirm, I’ll work with Randy tomorrow to fix!

 Tuesday, May 9, 2023 3:30 PM
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Client Billable Travel Expenses + POs
 
I wanted to check back in with you on travel and other expenses billable to clients and POs on invoices in Compass.
 
So far the only approved travel that is not billable to clients would be:
 
Travel to Minneapolis for the Forum
Travel to California by Alisa and Tamara
Travel to Denver by Alisa and Chuck
 
There is a retreat in Chicago where we should be seeing travel, as well.
 
Pam, please review all company card charges from January through 4/30 to determine any other charges that may be billable to clients and share that analysis here with the team.
 
Also, I have had a few invoices that have not included required POs.  I was able to locate them and update the invoices prior to submittal, but this might be a good item to review with the consultants to ensure that billing isn’t slowed down.  I am typically not aware until the time of uploading to the portal or after submission if a PO is required, but I feel the consultants would definitely know.
 
Thank you and let me know if you have any questions.
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW

Hi Alisa,
 
This policy was new with Guardian effective 010123 and we have not received a payment as of today.
 
A payment is needed today to keep it out of cancellation.
 
Below are the instructions on how to view and pay the invoices online.
 
Go to 
GuardianAnytime.com
·       Select the “Register Now” link located in the Log In box
·       Select your role on the Self Registration page (i.e. Employer)
·       Follow the easy instructions
·       You will need to provide your Group ID-
00045851
, RGO Code-075, A/R Code-CC2, and which divisions you will be administering.
 
 
 
Lori Zahn
Policyholder Service Associate III | Core Market Operations
Billing and Payments – List Bill
O:  800-627-4200
Lori_Zahn@glic.com

subject: RE: Invoicing - Johnson & Johnson - Conscious Inclusion Workshop - PA23-01
body:
Hi Pamela,
 
I looked into the other consultants’ records. There are (3) total payments from 2023 due from LCW to Brian Schroeder.
$1,000 Jan 2023 Fleishman Hillard (paid)
$1,500 Jan 2023 J&J (Unpaid)
$1,500 Feb 2023 J&J (Unpaid)
 
If you refer to the attachments I sent this morning, you will see two separate invoices for $1,500, neither of which have been paid. LCW paid Brian $1,000 for a different project. LCW still owes Brian $3,000, which is the sum of the two unpaid invoices.
 
Please confirm that LCW will pay Brian $3,000 on May 15.
 
Thank you,
 
Dan

Hi Michelle and Pamela,
 
I just received an urgent message from Brian Schroeder. 
He says that he has not received payment from LCW.
 His fiscal year ended March 31, and he needs to complete reporting ASAP.  These are way overdue—Brian is another one of our trusted partners who ensure that LCW is competitive at delivering to our largest clients. 
 
Please reply to this email with a status update on each of the invoices below:
 
2023-101
 $1,500 You mentioned was paid in the last message—can you provide a receipt or a date, if it has been?
2023-102
 $1,500 Attached is a copy of the email I forwarded to 
payableslcw@bill.com
 on February 23, 2023—that was 76 days ago. Can we please make sure this goes out today? Brian also requested that 
“the bank-to-bank wire transfer be paid in USD rather than HKD, and set it up so I pay the wire transfer fee rather than LCW.  The wire transfer fees are about USD10, substantially lower than using an electronic transfer as had been done in the past.”
 
Thank you,
 
Dan

Below are the instructions on how to view and pay the invoices online.
 
Go to 
GuardianAnytime.com

·       Follow the easy instructions
·       You will need to provide your Group ID-
00045851
, RGO Code-075, A/R Code-CC2, and which divisions you will be administering.

Subject:
 Client Billable Travel Expenses + POs
 
I wanted to check back in with you on travel and other expenses billable to clients and POs on invoices in Compass.
 
So far the only approved travel that is not billable to clients would be:
 
Travel to Minneapolis for the Forum
Travel to California by Alisa and Tamara
Travel to Denver by Alisa and Chuck
 
There is a retreat in Chicago where we should be seeing travel, as well.
 
Pam, please review all company card charges from January through 4/30 to determine any other charges that may be billable to clients and share that analysis here with the team.
 
Also, I have had a few invoices that have not included required POs.  I was able to locate them and update the invoices prior to submittal, but this might be a good item to review with the consultants to ensure that billing isn’t slowed down.  I am typically not aware until the time of uploading to the portal or after submission if a PO is required, but I feel the consultants would definitely know.
 
Thank you and let me know if you have any questions.
