Hello – thank you for this news! This would indicate to me that BSC has accepted the new credit memo, since it’s in the system! Great! From my understanding, the next step is for us (LCW) to submit a revised invoice against that credit memo with a differentiator, e.g. 22255-A, so that BSC can pay this invoice.
 
Here are the original steps Meg wrote out, we are on step 3:
 
BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete
)
LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (
complete! Looks like BSC has accepted the CM since it’s in the system!)
LCW posts invoice 22255 with a differentiator (e.g., 22255-A) – This is next!
BSC approves new invoice
 
 
@Bethany.Chan@bsci.com
, please confirm if you don’t mind!
 
@Michelle Murcia
, I am here to assist you in this process once Bethany confirms that is what we have to do.
 
Happy Friday and many thanks to all,
Sarah

Subject:
 Invoice Payment Update
 
Hi LCW team,
 
All previously submitted invoices have been paid, except invoice 22255 from PO 7000300301. As I suspected, reusing the invoice number caused a processing issue in our system. Here is what needs to be done to resolve the situation:
 
***
BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete
)
LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (see attached instructions)
LCW posts invoice 22255 with a differentiator (e.g., 22255-A)
BSC approves new invoice
 
I’m happy to answer any questions during tomorrow’s meeting.
 
Thanks,
Meg

subject: Re: Payment for invoice HH230004
body:
I will do a recon this weekend.  I feel this relates to a syncing issue between Bill.com and QB and my inexperience or delay in marking the payments made.  I will focus on it this weekend and share my analysis.
 
From: 
Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Date: 
Friday, May 5, 2023 at 4:52 PM
To: 
Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>, Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>, Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:

Hello – thank you for this news! This would indicate to me that BSC has accepted the new credit memo, since it’s in the system! Great! From my understanding, the next step is for us (LCW) to submit a revised invoice against that credit memo with a differentiator, e.g. 22255-A, so that BSC can pay this invoice.
 
Here are the original steps Meg wrote out, we are on step 3:

Hi LCW team,
 
All previously submitted invoices have been paid, except invoice 22255 from PO 7000300301. As I suspected, reusing the invoice number caused a processing issue in our system. Here is what needs to be done to resolve the situation:
 
***
BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete
)
LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (see attached instructions)
LCW posts invoice 22255 with a differentiator (e.g., 22255-A)
BSC approves new invoice
 
I’m happy to answer any questions during tomorrow’s meeting.
 
Thanks,
Meg

subject: 00045851 GUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE
body:
Group: 00045851
Division: 0000
 
Dear Valued Guardian Customer:
 
Your group is fully paid till 05/01/23 due date there is no outstanding balance till the date.
 
We have received your request to utilize our Guard-O-Matic electronic payment method.
 
Please complete the enclosed Guard-O-Matic authorization form and return it along with a sample check from your corporate account, clearly marked "void".  In place of a void check, a legible photocopy of a check from your account is also acceptable.  The company name and address must be printed on the check.  If no checks exist, submit a signed letter from your bank which includes the following account information:  name of depositor, account number, routing and transit number.  
 
Please note:  the company name reflected on the application and the sample check must coincide with the contract name.
 
Please return this information as soon as possible to guardianmaintenance_billing@glic.com or fax to 610-807-2994.
 
 
To protect your security please be sure that you always utilize our secure channel on Guardian Anytime to submit inquiries.  Simply go to 
GuardianAnytime.com
 and click on “secure channel” or “contact us”.  For immediate assistance with inquiries please contact our Customer Response Unit at 800-627-4200.  If you respond to this email, please reply with history to ensure this request is handled properly.
 
Sincerely,
 
Customer Service Delivery
Customer Eligibility & Payment Services
 
Reference Number:  sdevado/149237637
 
The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America
Manage your account easily online.  Take a tour or log in:  
GuardianAnytime.com

Subject:
 RE: Ralph Lauren
 
I would recommend we empty out both the invoice and Scoro and the invoice in QB – and then generate 2 new invoices and re-sync them to QB.  Modifying in Scoro and then syncing to QB may or may not work as intended – and once an invoice in Scoro is linked to an invoice in QB, it’s gets hard (apparently) to separate them.
 
So, remove the deliverables from the invoice in Scoro and make them billable again. Void out the invoice in QB.  Re-create 2 new invoices in Scoro and sync both to QB – and then submit normally.
 
Thx,
R

Hey, Randy – It’s not $200k. It’s $101,250 to my understanding.
 
I believe that she had two invoices (17240180 for $43,500 and 17240300 for $57,750) that she told Sarah had been set to “Ready to Invoice” only to find out later that they hadn’t been (I think this was the David period). Since then RL has determined that they want them billed in different amounts to two new PO that they raised in their Ariba portal to split the costs across profit centers.
 
$73,250 – RL CorpUSA
$28,000 – RL Europe Sarl Switzerland
 
 
The question I had was does it make more sense to delete the two old invoices and create new ones to submit in the Ariba portal? What impact would that have in Compass or QBO? 
 
Does that help clarify?
 
Chuck

Hi Alisa,
 
This policy was new with Guardian effective 010123 and we have not received a payment as of today.
 
A payment is needed today to keep it out of cancellation.
 
Below are the instructions on how to view and pay the invoices online.
 
Go to 
GuardianAnytime.com
·       Select the “Register Now” link located in the Log In box
·       Select your role on the Self Registration page (i.e. Employer)

Hi Michelle – Guardian is not receiving the premium payments and we would love to have it auto debited going forward. Can you pay this one time using the instructions highlighted in yellow below? Secondly, can you fill out the auto debit form attached so the payment will be taken care of going forward and send it to Anastasia.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
 
From:
 Anastasia Smith <anastasia.smith@onedigital.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, February 13, 2023 2:39 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: 00045851 - LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE
 
Good afternoon, 
 
After some investigating, I have found out the below information regarding your Guardian billing. 
 
I called Guardian and they stated that the email received on 1/31 from Guardian stating the payment was received was incorrect. They show no payment yet for this year and I also went on to your Guardian portal and verified this. I apologize on behalf of Guardian providing the wrong info. They also said that although account or credit card info may be saved in the portal, this is not for auto-pay. 
 
I also inquired on the auto-payments. Jayson who had helped with implementation provided an email from Nicole stating you did not want to set up auto-draft at this time. If you do, the attached form would need to be completed along with a copy of a voided check and you can send that to me for processing. 
 
But first, we need to ensure payment is made for this year’s premiums of $402.08 as to not cause any disruption in member’s benefits. 
There are two ways to initiate payment: 
 
You can mail the payment check to the overnight address mentioned below;
 
PNC Bank c/o Guardian - Bethlehem
Lockbox Number 824404
525 Fellowship Rd, Suite 330
Mt. Laurel, NJ  08054-3415
 
To make payment via 
www.guardiananytime.com
 you can follow the below steps;
 
 
How do I make online premium payments?
As an Employer, you can make online payments in 
Guardian Anytime
 by following these steps.
From the menu options, select 
Billing 
and then 
Make a payment
.
Complete all the required bank account details of your business bank account.
Select the amount due on your current billing statement or designate another amount.
Click 
Continue
.
Let me know if you have any questions. 
 
Thanks!
 
 
 
Anastasia Smith
Benefits Consultant | Health and Benefits
Direct: 770-250-2913 | Toll Free: 877-904-1713 X 53115 
anastasia.smith@onedigital.com
  
 
 
 
PLEASE NOTE: When sending emails to CAC, please include your Company Name in the Subject Line.

Yes,  since we are US based, we are not subject to VAT taxes.  At least that was historically true -- so yes, VAT exempt. That said, some countries require tax withholding at the source,  like India.  
Everything for Kelly (JnJ) is all or mostly US... so it should be fine.

subject: Thank you for your Kelly Global Supplier Community Profile Update
body:
Dear Michelle Murica – Language and Culture Worldwide LLC, 
Thank you for updating your supplier profile in our 
Kelly Global Supplier Community
. Your profile is now fully reactivated and can be found when we source for potential opportunities that match your profile.
Please ensure to keep your profile and contact details updated at any time to enable seamless communication and interaction, else you will be notified annually to update your profile or indicate you have no changes at that time. 
If you have further questions, please do not hesitate to contact our 
Supply Chain Enablement Team
 at any time.
We look forward to our ongoing partnership.
Sincerely,
Supply Chain Enablement

From:

Sent:
 Monday, February 13, 2023 1:39 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: 00045851 - LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE
 
Good afternoon, 
 
After some investigating, I have found out the below information regarding your Guardian billing. 
 
I called Guardian and they stated that the email received on 1/31 from Guardian stating the payment was received was incorrect. They show no payment yet for this year and I also went on to your Guardian portal and verified this. I apologize on behalf of Guardian providing the wrong info. They also said that although account or credit card info may be saved in the portal, this is not for auto-pay. 
 
I also inquired on the auto-payments. Jayson who had helped with implementation provided an email from Nicole stating you did not want to set up auto-draft at this time. If you do, the attached form would need to be completed along with a copy of a voided check and you can send that to me for processing. 
 
But first, we need to ensure payment is made for this year’s premiums of $402.08 as to not cause any disruption in member’s benefits. 
There are two ways to initiate payment: 
 
You can mail the payment check to the overnight address mentioned below;
 
PNC Bank c/o Guardian - Bethlehem
Lockbox Number 824404
525 Fellowship Rd, Suite 330
Mt. Laurel, NJ  08054-3415
 
To make payment via 
www.guardiananytime.com
 you can follow the below steps;
 
 
How do I make online premium payments?
As an Employer, you can make online payments in 
Guardian Anytime
 by following these steps.
From the menu options, select 
Billing 
and then 
Make a payment
.
Complete all the required bank account details of your business bank account.
Select the amount due on your current billing statement or designate another amount.
Click 
Continue
.
Let me know if you have any questions. 
 
Thanks!
 
 
 
Anastasia Smith
Benefits Consultant | Health and Benefits
Direct: 770-250-2913 | Toll Free: 877-904-1713 X 53115 
anastasia.smith@onedigital.com

Hi LCW team,
 
All previously submitted invoices have been paid, except invoice 22255 from PO 7000300301. As I suspected, reusing the invoice number caused a processing issue in our system. Here is what needs to be done to resolve the situation:
 
***
BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete
)
LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (see attached instructions)
LCW posts invoice 22255 with a differentiator (e.g., 22255-A)
BSC approves new invoice

I would recommend we empty out both the invoice and Scoro and the invoice in QB – and then generate 2 new invoices and re-sync them to QB.  Modifying in Scoro and then syncing to QB may or may not work as intended – and once an invoice in Scoro is linked to an invoice in QB, it’s gets hard (apparently) to separate them.
 
So, remove the deliverables from the invoice in Scoro and make them billable again. Void out the invoice in QB.  Re-create 2 new invoices in Scoro and sync both to QB – and then submit normally.
 
Thx,
R

Hey, Randy – It’s not $200k. It’s $101,250 to my understanding.
 
I believe that she had two invoices (17240180 for $43,500 and 17240300 for $57,750) that she told Sarah had been set to “Ready to Invoice” only to find out later that they hadn’t been (I think this was the David period). Since then RL has determined that they want them billed in different amounts to two new PO that they raised in their Ariba portal to split the costs across profit centers.
 
$73,250 – RL CorpUSA
$28,000 – RL Europe Sarl Switzerland
 
 
The question I had was does it make more sense to delete the two old invoices and create new ones to submit in the Ariba portal? What impact would that have in Compass or QBO? 
 
Does that help clarify?
 
Chuck

Cc:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Accounts Receivable / J&J
 
Alisa,
 
Randy and I were able to connect a couple of weeks ago, and I was able to finally resolve the conflicts between Compass and Quickbooks.  
 
What we discovered during our meeting last week was that Dan had created new invoices for J&J and deleted the old invoices in Scoro when they released the new PO, however the old invoices were still in Quickbooks, which overstated AR by $185,503.50.  
 
Based on this and the recent email correspondence from Grace on Ralph Lauren, I printed out the Client Balance Detail Report from Quickbooks and compared it to the outstanding invoices in Scoro, and identified another $82,919.74 of aged receivables in Quickbooks that had been deleted in Scoro on the following accounts:
 
123 Training / 17240206 / $646.92
Alliant Insurance / 1724050 / $210.32
Diligent Corporation / 22218 / $100.00
GroupM / 17240239 / $33,000.00
Prudential / 17240224 / $7,093.75
Ralph Lauren / 17240070 / $2,493.75
Ralph Lauren / 17240217 / $39,375.00
 
I voided these invoices in Quickbooks.  I have already deleted them from the receivables in the CFF.
 
Additionally, the following invoice in Quickbooks does not match the total in Scoro:
Gusto / 17240195 / $16,712.50 QB / $19,250.00 Scoro
 
I’ll get with the consultant to understand the implications, as the invoice was sent to the client in December and is still unpaid as of today. 
 
And Quad 17240119 and 19240267were duplicates, which adjusts revenue and receivables by another $7,500.
 
We’ve also got an unapplied customer credit of $12,885.00 for Diligent dated 11/21/22 which appears in AR as an offset.  I reversed it from AR and booked it as a customer deposit at year end by journal entry, and applied against future invoices.
 
The net impact on AR is that it was overstated by $291,345.74.  
 
Additionally, one of the invoices paid by J&J was short-paid due to the amount available under the PO by $4,551.46.  
 
We are still left with significant past due receivables.  I will update the CFF tomorrow and get that out to everyone copied here for visibility.
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW

m.murcia@lcwmail.com

Andrea, I submitted the invoice via email and they kicked it back to be submitted via the Ariba portal.  The way they break down the service delivery in the billing system is different than how we invoiced the work, and randomly it won’t let me zero out the travel expense reimbursement line item.  As a solution, I thought I would break down our invoice as follows:
 
DEI Training 2023: 118,500 units at $1 = $118,500
Travel and Expense Allowance: $17,800
 
I’m worried that if you do have reimbursable travel expenses, we might max out that section, so could just use 1 unit at $1 and push the difference to DEI Training 2023.  What would you suggest?  Do you have any travel expenses that can be billed under this contract?

subject: Amortization Schedules?
body:
Pam,
 
Do we have amortization schedules for these assets?
 
I’m not seeing any quarterly expense related to the amortization for Q1.

subject: Accrued 2022 Bonuses
body:
Pam,
 
Looks like there were bonuses accrued in 2022 (see attached) that should have been part of the journal entry for the bonus payments made in Q1.  This activity would be picked up in the balance sheet reconciliation process.
 
Please work with Rosie make an entry to match the bonus payments made in Q1 so that expense is not overstated and to relieve the accrual.

subject: Credit Memo Needed
body: Pam, can you create a credit memo dated 11/21/11 for this overpayment by Diligent that was applied as an offset to accounts receivable.  I moved it to 2301 Deferred Revenue, but it should really be a credit memo for Diligent and applied to a future invoice.  I will communicate with the consultant and Randy (who made the entry to offset AR) to make sure we haven’t already applied a credit to an invoice, but in the meantime, this should be booked as a credit memo in QB.  Thanks.

subject: Aflac Invoice 17240335
body:
Andrea, I submitted the invoice via email and they kicked it back to be submitted via the Ariba portal.  The way they break down the service delivery in the billing system is different than how we invoiced the work, and randomly it won’t let me zero out the travel expense reimbursement line item.  As a solution, I thought I would break down our invoice as follows:
 
DEI Training 2023: 118,500 units at $1 = $118,500
Travel and Expense Allowance: $17,800
 
I’m worried that if you do have reimbursable travel expenses, we might max out that section, so could just use 1 unit at $1 and push the difference to DEI Training 2023.  What would you suggest?  Do you have any travel expenses that can be billed under this contract?
 
 
Here’s ours:
 
 
And here’s theirs:

The wire routing for chase is 021000021
Sent from my iPhone
On Apr 29, 2023, at 4:22 PM, Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com> wrote:
﻿ 
Since it was already paid through Bill.com, I had to process a replacement payment.  Since his instructions were for ACH, it was processed as a replacement ACH.  Bill.com always has a lag, so these funds will process on Monday and he should receive the funds shortly thereafter.  If we need to cancel this and process ACH directly through the bank, please let me know.  
 
As a reminder, the vendor was invited to Bill.com but indicated that he didn’t want to “sign up for anything else”, so he elected a check payment.  The address used for this payment was the address on his W-9.  He is currently in another location, so will not get that check.  Next step then is to void the transaction in Bill.com and reissue the payment via his preferred payment method, which he indicated was wire, but the routing details for which are ACH.  So we processed as ACH.  You can see below in the last section that it was voided and reissued as ACH on 4/29.
 
It will certainly be faster if Alisa issues a manual wire on Monday, but we would have to track down his bank’s wire routing number to avoid further delays.
 
<image001.png>

subject: Re: Update Please
body:
Since it was already paid through Bill.com, I had to process a replacement payment.  Since his instructions were for ACH, it was processed as a replacement ACH.  Bill.com always has a lag, so these funds will process on Monday and he should receive the funds shortly thereafter.  If we need to cancel this and process ACH directly through the bank, please let me know.  
 
As a reminder, the vendor was invited to Bill.com but indicated that he didn’t want to “sign up for anything else”, so he elected a check payment.  The address used for this payment was the address on his W-9.  He is currently in another location, so will not get that check.  Next step then is to void the transaction in Bill.com and reissue the payment via his preferred payment method, which he indicated was wire, but the routing details for which are ACH.  So we processed as ACH.  You can see below in the last section that it was voided and reissued as ACH on 4/29.
 
It will certainly be faster if Alisa issues a manual wire on Monday, but we would have to track down his bank’s wire routing number to avoid further delays.

Grace, I’m copying in Alisa.  
 
** Please do not forward this signed form until Alisa and Chuck replay to this message **
 
We have completed the form but there are some terms in the back of this form that are concerning, so I would like for someone on the LCW leadership team to give their blessing.  Maybe I’m over thinking it but this appears to be more than a supplier form that gets filled out by accounting. It encapsulates all of the terms and conditions of the PO.  Specifically, this section is concerning.   Equally concerning are the terms around Work for Hire.  
 
Chuck, how does the company currently manage the PO process.  Is this typical for accounting paperwork to include the terms of any PO, or have you already reviewed this during the business development process?  Does the company typically give full license to use LCWs materials? This doesn’t seem to limit their use or dissemination of your proprietary information. Full document is attached for your review and consideration.

Thank you so much.
 
Grace

Grace, I’m copying in Alisa.  
 
** Please do not forward this signed form until Alisa and Chuck replay to this message **
 
We have completed the form but there are some terms in the back of this form that are concerning, so I would like for someone on the LCW leadership team to give their blessing.  Maybe I’m over thinking it but this appears to be more than a supplier form that gets filled out by accounting. It encapsulates all of the terms and conditions of the PO.  Specifically, this section is concerning.   Equally concerning are the terms around Work for Hire.  
 
Chuck, how does the company currently manage the PO process.  Is this typical for accounting paperwork to include the terms of any PO, or have you already reviewed this during the business development process?  Does the company typically give full license to use LCWs materials? This doesn’t seem to limit their use or dissemination of your proprietary information. Full document is attached for your review and consideration.

Maria, the vendor was unable to change her banking details in Bill.com – our standard method of payment. 
We asked Veronica to create an account on Bill.com to receive payments moving forward. This attempt was unsuccessful since she is a non-USA resident – none of our vendors abroad has been able to create an account. 
We were asked to manually update her banking information and it was rejected by Bill.com. 
Since Veronica couldn’t sign up for Bill.com, I asked if we could pay via wire transfer since her invoice was already overdue. This invoice also had the new account information and I asked to please make a note of it. 
We then requested her wire details and attempted to wire funds to her, which were returned to our bank.  
Correct. I was informed money was returned on 4/13 and confirmed with her that we had the correct information to the new account. Again, that doesn’t explain why our bank transferred a penny on 4/17. Is there a way to ask our bank what happened? This puzzles me.
 We can certainly try again to get the funds to her, 
that would be fantastic since this is her preferred method. Please let me know if it works this time… 
but we seem to have exhausted all possible means of paying her other than PayPal.
 
Pam, please correct me if I’m wrong.
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting,

On Apr 27, 2023, at 3:30 PM, Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com> wrote:
﻿ 
I’m guessing there’s a history here, Jennifer, so let us know.
 
Our process is to call to confirm the wire information prior to setting it up.  Did the check clear or was it returned?  
 
We use Bill.com to ensure that the vendors are setting up their own wire details.  He has provided them on a new invoice when he previously declined electronic payment, which is concerning.
 
Does he have his phone number on both invoices and is it the same?

With information provided on W9 and information at the top of his invoice.
 
He declined setting up his bank info in Bill.com.
 
He then sent an updated invoice with a new amount, that I updated in Bill.com
However, on the last page of the invoice he requested a wire transfer happen and gave WT information that I did not see.
 
1 – we need to cancel the check issued in Bill.com
2 – reissue payment w wire transfer info that is on invoice saved in Bill.com

Michelle

Payment by wire off his invoice.
 
 
Pamela Coulter

Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>
Cc: 
Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
Re: Update Please
Idk honestly what happened. I was pulled into the conversation because he said it’s been weeks and he wasn’t paid.
Sent from my iPhone
On Apr 27, 2023, at 3:30 PM, Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com> wrote:
﻿ 
I’m guessing there’s a history here, Jennifer, so let us know.
 
Our process is to call to confirm the wire information prior to setting it up.  Did the check clear or was it returned?  
 
We use Bill.com to ensure that the vendors are setting up their own wire details.  He has provided them on a new invoice when he previously declined electronic payment, which is concerning.
 
Does he have his phone number on both invoices and is it the same?  
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW

m.murcia@lcwmail.com
Mobile: +1.614.546.8422

Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
Re: Update Please
He submitted an invoice, I set up vendor in Bill.com.
With information provided on W9 and information at the top of his invoice.
 
He declined setting up his bank info in Bill.com.
 
He then sent an updated invoice with a new amount, that I updated in Bill.com
However, on the last page of the invoice he requested a wire transfer happen and gave WT information that I did not see.
 
1 – we need to cancel the check issued in Bill.com
2 – reissue payment w wire transfer info that is on invoice saved in Bill.com

subject: Re: Update Please
body:
Idk honestly what happened. I was pulled into the conversation because he said it’s been weeks and he wasn’t paid.
Sent from my iPhone
On Apr 27, 2023, at 3:30 PM, Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com> wrote:
﻿
 
I’m guessing there’s a history here, Jennifer, so let us know.
 
Our process is to call to confirm the wire information prior to setting it up.  Did the check clear or was it returned?  
 
We use Bill.com to ensure that the vendors are setting up their own wire details.  He has provided them on a new invoice when he previously declined electronic payment, which is concerning.
 
Does he have his phone number on both invoices and is it the same?  
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW

Maria, the vendor was unable to change her banking details in Bill.com – our standard method of payment. 
We asked Veronica to create an account on Bill.com to receive payments moving forward. This attempt was unsuccessful since she is a non-USA resident – none of our vendors abroad has been able to create an account. 
We were asked to manually update her banking information and it was rejected by Bill.com. 
Since Veronica couldn’t sign up for Bill.com, I asked if we could pay via wire transfer since her invoice was already overdue. This invoice also had the new account information and I asked to please make a note of it. 
We then requested her wire details and attempted to wire funds to her, which were returned to our bank.  
Correct. I was informed money was returned on 4/13 and confirmed with her that we had the correct information to the new account. Again, that doesn’t explain why our bank transferred a penny on 4/17. Is there a way to ask our bank what happened? This puzzles me.
 We can certainly try again to get the funds to her, 
that would be fantastic since this is her preferred method. Please let me know if it works this time… 
but we seem to have exhausted all possible means of paying her other than PayPal.
 
Pam, please correct me if I’m wrong.

Maria, the vendor was unable to change her banking details in Bill.com – our standard method of payment. 
We asked Veronica to create an account on Bill.com to receive payments moving forward. This attempt was unsuccessful since she is a non-USA resident – none of our vendors abroad has been able to create an account. 
We were asked to manually update her banking information and it was rejected by Bill.com. 
Since Veronica couldn’t sign up for Bill.com, I asked if we could pay via wire transfer since her invoice was already overdue. This invoice also had the new account information and I asked to please make a note of it. 
We then requested her wire details and attempted to wire funds to her, which were returned to our bank.  
Correct. I was informed money was returned on 4/13 and confirmed with her that we had the correct information to the new account. Again, that doesn’t explain why our bank transferred a penny on 4/17. Is there a way to ask our bank what happened? This puzzles me.
 We can certainly try again to get the funds to her, 
that would be fantastic since this is her preferred method. Please let me know if it works this time… 
but we seem to have exhausted all possible means of paying her other than PayPal.
 
Pam, please correct me if I’m wrong.
 
 
Michelle Murcia

Hi LCW team,
 
All previously submitted invoices have been paid, except invoice 22255 from PO 7000300301. As I suspected, reusing the invoice number caused a processing issue in our system. Here is what needs to be done to resolve the situation:
 
***
BSC reopens PO 7000300301 (
complete
)
LCW submits a credit memo against invoice 22255 (see attached instructions)
LCW posts invoice 22255 with a differentiator (e.g., 22255-A)
BSC approves new invoice
 
I’m happy to answer any questions during tomorrow’s meeting. 
 
Thanks,
Meg

Dan

Subject:
 Re: Veronica's Payment. URGENT
 
Maria, the vendor was unable to change her banking details in Bill.com – our standard method of payment. 
We asked Veronica to create an account on Bill.com to receive payments moving forward. This attempt was unsuccessful since she is a non-USA resident – none of our vendors abroad has been able to create an account. 
We were asked to manually update her banking information and it was rejected by Bill.com. 
Since Veronica couldn’t sign up for Bill.com, I asked if we could pay via wire transfer since her invoice was already overdue. This invoice also had the new account information and I asked to please make a note of it. 
We then requested her wire details and attempted to wire funds to her, which were returned to our bank.  
Correct. I was informed money was returned on 4/13 and confirmed with her that we had the correct information to the new account. Again, that doesn’t explain why our bank transferred a penny on 4/17. Is there a way to ask our bank what happened? This puzzles me.
 We can certainly try again to get the funds to her, 
that would be fantastic since this is her preferred method. Please let me know if it works this time… 
but we seem to have exhausted all possible means of paying her other than PayPal.
 
Pam, please correct me if I’m wrong.
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW

 RE: Ralph Lauren
 
I would recommend we empty out both the invoice and Scoro and the invoice in QB – and then generate 2 new invoices and re-sync them to QB.  Modifying in Scoro and then syncing to QB may or may not work as intended – and once an invoice in Scoro is linked to an invoice in QB, it’s gets hard (apparently) to separate them.
 
So, remove the deliverables from the invoice in Scoro and make them billable again. Void out the invoice in QB.  Re-create 2 new invoices in Scoro and sync both to QB – and then submit normally.
 
Thx,
R

subject: Re: Payables
body:
Pam is doing a quick analysis of the situation, but it seems like several vendors are saying they received duplicate payments.  Most of them are PayPal.  
 
In the reconciliation process we also identified that the PayPal payments syncing from Bill.com seem to be mapping to the Citi account vs. the PayPal account (which also doesn’t show up on the banking panel as an account).  
 
We will be putting together the PPF today for approval and payment tomorrow, but still not sure what’s really happening between Bill.com and PP.
 
Pam should have those issues identified this afternoon, but likely not until after we meet to review the balance sheet.  Hope you’re available at 1:45!

I would recommend we empty out both the invoice and Scoro and the invoice in QB – and then generate 2 new invoices and re-sync them to QB.  Modifying in Scoro and then syncing to QB may or may not work as intended – and once an invoice in Scoro is linked to an invoice in QB, it’s gets hard (apparently) to separate them.
 
So, remove the deliverables from the invoice in Scoro and make them billable again. Void out the invoice in QB.  Re-create 2 new invoices in Scoro and sync both to QB – and then submit normally.
 
Thx,
R

I would recommend we empty out both the invoice and Scoro and the invoice in QB – and then generate 2 new invoices and re-sync them to QB.  Modifying in Scoro and then syncing to QB may or may not work as intended – and once an invoice in Scoro is linked to an invoice in QB, it’s gets hard (apparently) to separate them.
 
So, remove the deliverables from the invoice in Scoro and make them billable again. Void out the invoice in QB.  Re-create 2 new invoices in Scoro and sync both to QB – and then submit normally.
 
Thx,
R

Subject:
 RE: Ralph Lauren
 
I would recommend we empty out both the invoice and Scoro and the invoice in QB – and then generate 2 new invoices and re-sync them to QB.  Modifying in Scoro and then syncing to QB may or may not work as intended – and once an invoice in Scoro is linked to an invoice in QB, it’s gets hard (apparently) to separate them.
 
So, remove the deliverables from the invoice in Scoro and make them billable again. Void out the invoice in QB.  Re-create 2 new invoices in Scoro and sync both to QB – and then submit normally.
 
Thx,
R
